186035623.review:
I don't know what is up with nearly every platformer game having the worst controls imaginable.. in a game that is all about precise movement.
But this one might take the cake as the absolute worst of all of them.

The map is basically designed for you to "barely make it". Ori's jump height is absurdly low, even many simple traversal jumps require you to time it because you will only reach the ledge if you jump exactly at the last possible frame.
You also then have to hold space to jump higher. Which basically means if you press space you barely move at all. And holding space makes you jump the normal height which again is barely enough.

And soon you will encounter wall jumping which either has the most unforgiving timing or is straight up random on whether Ori will actually jump on the wall or will fall to his death. His grip on the wall just seems to be so inconsistent and there will be MANY wall jumping puzzles you need to solve. Each of them filled with spikes and fireballs which will kill you in 1 or 2 hits.

You should not make a game about precise movement and not provide that precise movement to the player. It's unbearable and infuriating.

186014016.review:
I hate to give this game a negative review because I really want to like this game. I tried on Switch and gave up, then I tried again on PC but ultimately gave up again. The game has a gorgeous artstyle and a beautiful soundtrack. The opening scene does a better job at evoking emotions than any AAA game with a multitude of the budget that Ori had.

With all that said I don't like the gameplay and that's the most important part of any game. The game focuses way too much on trial and error with a lot of cheap one-hit kills. And the game fully embraces this by having a mobile checkpoint system that gives the player control over when and where they want to respawn ... that is as long as you got the energy for that. If you don't, then tough luck. And since you don't know which sections will be troublesome on your first playthrough it's mostly guessing when and where to place those checkpoints.
Aside from the frustrating platforming the combat is really ... not that good. You basically only have a medium range homing missile attack and a close range blast attack but there is no range indicator so you have to guess if your attacks will hit or not which leads to a lot of hit and run. Hardly engaging ....

Terminei o jogo com pouco mais de 12h. Não fiz 100% em cada local, mas ficou na faixa de 95 a 98%. Pode-se dizer que é um jogo com uma história simples, porém cativante. A narração, o desenvolvimento da história e todo o ambiente vão te introduzindo num mundo mágico, porém perigoso. 

É um jogo difícil? A resposta é não! É um jogo desafiador e que requer uma boa habilidade no mouse teclado ou controle (recomendo controle). 

A jogabilidade, como é esse troço? Mano, como todos os jogos do tipo, a jogabilidade é muito boa. Não chega a ser um roguelike. Todas as funções, itens e habilidades são necessárias e precisas para continuação da história. Então não tem como ir pulando toda a história, tem literalmente de jogar e conseguir as habilidades para conseguir progredir no game. 

Posso falar muitas coisas sobre esse game, mas me encerro. Se tem dúvidas, pode comprar sem medo, jogo é bom demais! Que a árvore do espírito abençoe vocês.

English

Unbeatable

Poor controls in Ori (not precise). This was implemented perfectly in Rayman, Rougue Legacy and Hollow Night. A jump and run needs good controls.
Lots of bugs regarding controls in Ori. Some controllers don't work at all.
It is then recommended to deactivate 12 of your 20 processor cores and install Win 8 Triber.
On an AMD 6600xt the game only runs at 1080p and 60fps
The game is too difficult. Which doesn't make sense. The game should be pretty and have a nice story. But that's no use if you're torn out of the flow by frustration at insurmountable passages. I'm talking about Kaiso Mario passages here. Where you have to create frame perfect larger passages in one go.
You take far too much damage from obstacles.
I come from work and have maybe 2 hours to play. I can't sit down for a whole day to learn 5m levels in and out.
If you had put some effort into it, it would definitely have been a great game.
My viewers on Twitch don't like the game either. I won't buy the second part.
No effort has been made here.
Take a look at how other developers do it with the controls? Good controls are essential, especially in a jump and run.

185503140.review:
일단 나쁘지 않음. 근데 쓰레기.

 일단 키마 설정못함. 근데 대쉬랑 벽타기가 ctrl, 좌쉬프트임 ㅅㅂㅋㅋㅋㅋㅋㅋㅋ  참고로 둘이 돌아가며 쓸 때가 계속 나옴ㅋㅋ. 똥쓰레기 게임. 

에초에 전투 보스조차 없고, 잡몹처리 용도 밖에 사용처가 없으면서 3갈래의 스킬트리 중 하나를 순수 전투에 투자한 점이라던가, 게임 데스 대부분이 가시에 즉사고, 잡몹의 평타에도 피가 5, 6칸씩 명치가 뚫리는 게임에서 피 1, 2칸 늘어나는 체력셀이 메인 수집요소 라던가, 전반적으로 너무 적은 hp회복지점, 쓰레기 같은 활공의 조작감, ㅈ같은 가시 판정이라든지 게임 내에 불퀘하고, 불필요하고, 짜증나는 요소가 정말 많음. 몇몇 장소는 조작감이 똥구려져서 숨도 못 쉼. 참고로 가시판정은 해보면 알거임ㅋㅋ.

 아니 애초에 캐릭터 디자인을 홍길동마냥 동에번쩍 서에번쩍 훌쩍훌쩍 날아다닐 수 있게 설개하고선, 게임 내의 모든 요소들이 시원시원한 진행을 방해하고 있음. 동시에 강타, 적 공격 반사, 찍기 같이 수많은 전투기술을 배워도 보스전이 없어 길 뚫기 말고는 아에 사용 안 하는게 말이 되냐고ㅋㅋㅋㅋㅋ.  바닥에 장판 깔아서 기다리게 하는 잡몹이라던가, 심지어 아에 한 스테이지를 템포 떨어지는 활공으로 채우는 건 그냥 존나 설계 미스로 밖에 안 보일 정도로 불퀘한 경험 그자체임ㅇㅇ.

 이게 처음 물차오를 땐 인생에 손에 꼽을 정도로 재밌어서 개추개추 상태였는데, 그게 고점일 줄은 생각도 못했지. 그 다음엔 아에 활공으로 날로 때워버리니까 김이 팍 죽어버림. ㄹㅇ 거기 설계한 새끼는 동탁같은 새끼니까 빨리 쳐내야함.

185477044.review:
For someone who has a hard time getting into Metroidvania-styled games, I initially wasn't expecting much when first playing this game. But after completing the game twice (once on the Original Edition and the other on the Definitive Edition), this game exceeded my expectations substantially. Ori and the Blind Forest is a damn good game. I've got my problems with it, but overall it was a very fun experience.

[b][i] If anyone plans on playing this game on the Steam Deck (specifically the OLED model), [/i][/b] I highly recommend that you change the Frame Limit to 80 Frames Per Second or lower as going above that will cause the game to slow down drastically. I didn't know this when playing the first few minutes of the game on my Steam Deck and because of it, it did leave me with a bad first impression of the game. Once I did figure out the problem though, the game's performance got a lot better. It's also worth bringing up that the game itself is faster when playing above 60 FPS, so do be aware of this if you want to play the game with more frames. With that out of the way, I should start talking about what I like and dislike about the game.

[h3] What I liked about the game: [/h3]

The first thing I'll compliment the game for are the visuals and the story. The visuals look incredible even for a game that's been out for nearly 10 years now. As for the story, that was also pretty great. Even though it's somewhat basic with similar ideas seen in the stories of other games and media, the way it was told was very effective. The characters themselves were also pretty great and there were rarely any characters I disliked.

As for the gameplay itself, I thought it was really solid. I've played a lot of platformers so it wasn't too difficult for me to get a hang of the controls. The abilities you get as you continue throughout the game are also really fun to use. The game also does a pretty good job at teaching you how to use those abilities and also gives you more information as to how you can use them when fighting or solving puzzles.

The soundtrack is also one of the main highlights for this game. Ori and the Blind Forest has one of the best video game soundtracks I've listened to in a long time and they heavily make the story a lot more emotional because of it. Gareth Coker and everyone else involved with this game's soundtrack did a phenomenal job when making this game feel more lively.

I also find it pretty neat that buying this game also gives you the original version of the game in addition to the Definitive Edition.

[h3] Problems that I had with it: [/h3]

When it comes to the problems I have with this game, I really only have 2 complaints.

The first problem I have is the difficulty spike in some areas, even the ones somewhat early in the game. Even when replaying the game, I still died a couple of times in some of those areas. I could see the argument that there is a bit of a skill issue involved, but then again both of my playthroughs were on the Normal difficulty.

The second issue I have with the game is the combat. While I don't hate it, it does feel pretty shallow. The combat in this game mostly boils down to spamming the same attack over and over again. As you unlock more abilities by progressing throughout the game, you do have other options when fighting enemies, but some of them aren't as effective to dealing damage when compared to your main weapon. While not terrible, I do wish the combat in this game was a little more interactive. In fact, this was an issue that got addressed in the sequel, [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/1057090/Ori_and_the_Will_of_the_Wisps/?curator_clanid=37856651] Ori and the Will of the Wisps [/url], which is also a great game and makes some pretty good improvements to its predecessor.

[h3] Overall Thoughts: [/h3]

Overall, Ori and the Blind Forest is a beautiful game that is worth playing just for its presentation alone. As I brought up in the beginning, I initially had a hard time getting into Metroidvania-like games, but after playing this game, it actually made me want to give other games in this genre a try. As I brought up previously, if you end up enjoying this game as much as I did, I would highly recommend playing the sequel as well.

185458791.review:
Ori and the Blind Forest is a game that feels like a labor of love from start to finish. Developed by Moon Studios, it’s a breathtaking Metroidvania that combines stunning visuals, an emotional story, and refined gameplay into an unforgettable experience.

At its heart, Ori and the Blind Forest is a tale of love, loss, and redemption. The story begins with a powerful emotional hook as Ori, a small guardian spirit, is separated from their caretaker and must navigate a dying forest to restore its balance. The game’s storytelling is minimal yet deeply impactful, relying on beautiful animations, evocative music, and heartfelt narration to convey its emotional depth.

The art direction is simply mesmerizing. Every frame of the game feels like a hand-painted masterpiece, from the glowing blues of the Sunken Glades to the fiery reds of Mount Horu. The lush, vibrant environments not only look incredible but also feel alive, drawing you into the world of Nibel with every step.

Gameplay in Ori and the Blind Forest is a perfect blend of platforming precision and exploration. Ori’s movement is fluid and graceful, and as you unlock new abilities, like wall-jumping, double-jumping, and the exhilarating Bash attack, you feel increasingly empowered to traverse the world’s intricate levels. The game’s Metroidvania structure is superbly designed, with each new ability opening up new paths and secrets to uncover.

The platforming challenges are where the game truly shines. Ori isn’t afraid to test your skills, with sequences that demand precision, timing, and quick thinking. The escape sequences, where you must flee from rising water or collapsing terrain, are heart-pounding highlights that showcase the game’s perfect balance of challenge and reward.

The combat, while simple, is effective and serves its purpose well. Ori’s Spirit Flame allows you to fight off enemies while focusing on exploration and movement. However, it’s the environmental hazards and platforming that present the real challenges, making each victory feel earned.

The game’s emotional core is amplified by Gareth Coker’s incredible score. The music is as much a part of the experience as the visuals or gameplay, with hauntingly beautiful melodies that evoke wonder, sorrow, and hope. The soundtrack elevates every moment, from quiet, contemplative exploration to the game’s most dramatic and emotional scenes.

If there’s any criticism to be made, it’s that Ori and the Blind Forest can be quite challenging, particularly for players who aren’t used to precision platformers. However, the game’s generous checkpoint system ensures that even the most demanding sections feel achievable with persistence.

Ori and the Blind Forest is more than just a game, it’s a heartfelt work of art that stays with you long after the credits roll. It’s a story about resilience, love, and the beauty of the natural world, told through some of the most gorgeous visuals and gameplay in modern gaming. Whether you’re a fan of platformers, stunning art, or emotional narratives, Ori and the Blind Forest is an absolute must-play.

185269091.review:
A Stunningly Beautiful and Emotional Masterpiece

Ori and the Blind Forest: Definitive Edition is an unforgettable experience that seamlessly combines breathtaking visuals, tight gameplay, and a deeply emotional story. It’s a perfect example of how video games can be both art and entertainment, and it sets the standard for modern platformers.

The first thing that strikes you is the game’s incredible art style. The hand-painted environments are absolutely gorgeous, with vibrant colors and intricate details that bring the forest to life. Every frame feels like a painting, from the glowing trees to the misty caves. The animation is fluid and elegant, making Ori’s movements a joy to watch. Paired with the stunning visuals is an enchanting orchestral soundtrack that perfectly captures the game’s emotional highs and lows. The music is hauntingly beautiful and adds so much weight to the story and atmosphere.

Speaking of story, Ori and the Blind Forest delivers a heartfelt narrative without relying on dialogue. The opening sequence alone is enough to pull at your heartstrings, and the journey that follows is filled with moments of triumph, sorrow, and wonder. The game masterfully uses its visuals, music, and world design to tell a story that feels both personal and universal.

The gameplay is just as impressive as the presentation. The platforming is fluid and responsive, with Ori gaining a variety of abilities as you progress. Each new skill feels natural and adds depth to the traversal and combat. The level design is brilliant, with interconnected areas that encourage exploration and reward curiosity. The pacing is perfect, steadily introducing new challenges and mechanics that keep the gameplay fresh and engaging.

The Definitive Edition makes an already incredible game even better, adding new areas, abilities, and quality-of-life improvements. The inclusion of fast travel and additional difficulty options makes the experience more accessible, while the new content provides even more reasons to revisit this magical world.

What truly sets Ori and the Blind Forest apart is its emotional core. The game isn’t just about platforming—it’s about perseverance, love, and sacrifice. Every moment feels meaningful, and by the end, you’ll feel deeply connected to Ori’s journey.

Whether you’re a fan of platformers or just looking for a beautiful, emotional adventure, Ori and the Blind Forest: Definitive Edition is a must-play. It’s a game that will stay with you long after the credits roll.

[i]Эта игра — сказка наяву, где ты просто погружаешься в мир волшебства и не хочешь вылезать обратно![/i]
 • графика настолько прекрасная, что иногда хочется просто встать на месте и насладиться моментом (да, я стояла и смотрела на светлячков минут пять, Ори это заслуживает)
 • музыка — ах, эта музыка, прямо в сердечко… будто сама лесная сказка, от каждой ноты хочется жить и чувствовать ещё больше
 • история Ори и её друзей: не просто сюжет, а живое приключение, где ты переживаешь за каждого персонажа (приготовьте платочки, возможно, будет трогательно, и да, плакать можно)
 • акробатические прыжки! Серьезно, кто знал, что светящийся комочек может вытворять такие штуки, что даже глазам не веришь! Прыжки, удары, полёты — ну это восторг

Меня эта игра буквально захватила с первой секунды! Вот ты сидишь, погружаешься в мир, и тут — магия. Причём магия из-за КАЖДОЙ детали: цвета, движения, персонажи, лес вокруг тебя… чувствуешь, что это не просто игра, а маленькое путешествие. Даже враги, хотя и мешают тебе продвигаться, всё равно выглядят… ну, как часть этой самой магии!

Особое спасибо авторам за внимание к деталям. Даже камушки на дороге — да-да, камушки! — кажутся частью большого замысла. Видно, что это не просто лес, а живой мир, который, как и ты, проходит через свои испытания.

И ещё раз про музыку! (Да, я помню, что уже говорила о ней, но это просто что-то, друзья) — каждая мелодия прям впечатывается в душу. Это не просто фон, это настоящий саундтрек к твоей истории, заставляет тебя сопереживать, радоваться, грустить и чувствовать каждый миг приключения.

ИТОГ: Это не просто игра, это волшебный лесной сон, от которого не хочется просыпаться!

[h1]Recensione di Ori and the Blind Forest[/h1]

Ori and the Blind Forest è un'esperienza che va oltre il semplice videogioco: è una vera e propria opera d'arte interattiva. Fin dai primi minuti, mi ha catturato con la sua atmosfera unica e la sua narrazione emozionante, al punto da tenermi incollato allo schermo per ore senza mai sentire il peso del tempo.

La colonna sonora è semplicemente sublime. Ogni nota sembra intrecciarsi perfettamente con le vicende di Ori, amplificando le emozioni di ogni momento. Alcuni passaggi musicali mi hanno commosso profondamente, rendendo ancora più intensa l'immersione nel mondo del gioco.

Dal punto di vista grafico, Ori and the Blind Forest è un capolavoro. I disegni, ricchi di dettagli e colori vibranti, creano un universo incantato che sembra prendere vita. Ogni scenario è una tela dipinta a mano, e ogni angolo del gioco è curato con una dedizione straordinaria.

La combinazione tra gameplay avvincente, musica toccante e un comparto visivo mozzafiato rende Ori and the Blind Forest un'esperienza che consiglio a chiunque. Non è solo un gioco, ma un viaggio emozionale che resterà con me per molto tempo.

185139154.review:
Em um mundo de animais falantes e criaturas fantásticas, ''Ori e a floresta cega'' narra a história de um espirito, o próprio Ori. Este espirito acabou se desprendendo do seu lar original e é adotado por uma nova mãe, Naru. Depois de muito tempo dessa separação, o mundo entra em colapso e desequilíbrio, após isso, Ori é a ultima esperança daquele mundo decadente e deve restaurar os elementos vitais para tudo voltar ao normal.

 Em questão de visual, Ori é um jogo incrível, com paisagens lindas e cenários deslumbrantes. Sua trilha sonora e efeitos sonoros também não deixam a desejar, tudo se encaixa perfeitamente e funciona como uma linda orquestra tocando uma sinfonia impecável. Já em questão de gameplay, Ori tem um sistema simples, sem muitas variações de ataque físico, mas, em movimentação, ele já apresenta varias ideias e conceitos diferentes de como encarar a jogabilidade, sendo bem fluido e desafiante, porém, em alguns casos, é prazeroso de quão fluido consegue ser em algumas partes.

 A sua história é bem linear, com extras espalhados, mas que não fogem muito do caminho principal e não são necessárias para o decorrer do jogo. A história se resume a ir em áreas especificas e completar um  objetivo ou buscar algo para completar este objetivo, é simples e agradável, muito fácil de entender. Ela é muito bem contada, sem enrolar ou pular fatos.

 Agora para os contras: O jogo é bem desafiante, não que seja algo ruim, mas você vai morrer bastante e talvez até passar raiva durante segmentos do jogo, mas, sendo satisfatório finalmente passar destes desafios. O jogo não possui ''auto save'', apenas quando uma cutscene acontece; um item principal é coletado ou um segmento importante acontece. Então, você terá que salvar manualmente nas fontes espirituais ou usando o seu Elo, que gasta um de mana, pode parecer muito, mas não é. O problema é que as vezes você não terá a mana e as vezes ira esquecer de salvar, isso é bem irritante e pode comprometer sua experiencia. 

 No fim, é um ótimo jogo, sua continuação não é igual e não tem como comparar pois são duas obras de arte diferentes. Recomendo jogar e aproveitar do jeito que você achar melhor, sem desistir. ele chega a ser curto e bem fácil de completar, espero que goste.

185135298.review: É um jogo muito bonito com uns dos melhores gráficos e trilhas sonoras que eu já joguei, tem mecânicas fáceis mas ao mesmo tempo complexas com os desafios pelo caminho. Gosto muito do jogo, tanto desse quanto do 2° jogo, os dois tem uma história muito bonita com gráficos ainda melhores.

184923138.review:
I recommend this game, but it's far from perfect. Ori and the Blind Forest is a visually stunning game with a captivating story. The presentation is superb; if you told me it was an adaptation of a beloved children's book I would believe you. The gameplay is enjoyable and features innovative movement upgrades for a metroidvania.

Unfortunately, the game overuses particle effects, which is especially noticeable in the lackluster combat system. Combat often boils down to "spamming the attack button near enemies and dodging their projectiles by either jumping or standing still," which results in a chaotic mess of particle effects. While the game isn’t particularly difficult, it has a few sections where instant death is overused as a means to increase difficulty.

Ori is worth playing for the story and presentation, but if you want a good metroidvania, play the many other options.

Sou nova nesse meio gamer. Até então, eu só jogava jogos considerados "tóxicos" e achava que isso era o suficiente. No entanto, acabei cedendo às insistências do meu namorado para experimentar jogos diferentes. Assim o fiz. Comecei jogando alguns outros títulos que hoje em dia gosto muito. Porém, depois que comprei este jogo (mais uma vez graças à insistência do meu digníssimo), me apaixonei completamente. Sem dúvidas, esse é o meu estilo de jogo: indie e metroidvania.

Falando um pouco sobre o jogo, ele tem uma ambientação incrível, gráficos maravilhosos e uma história comovente, porém cheia de significado e com um desfecho emocionante. Não se engane pensando que será uma experiência leve e tranquila. Embora seja incrível, o jogo traz desafios que, em alguns momentos, podem fazer você querer desistir e até desinstalá-lo. Perdi a conta de quantas vezes precisei repetir a mesma fase. Mas, analisando de forma geral, valeu muito a pena.

Recomendo muito a compra de Ori, mas acredito que não compensa adquirir pelo valor cheio. Se possível, aproveite uma promoção, como eu fiz. Paguei R$ 24,00 e foi, sem dúvida, um dos melhores investimentos.

If you haven't played this game...do yourself a favor and get it. It is amazing! The art style is beautiful, the story is great, the music is extremely well done and the abilities are really fun to play around with.

I do have a couple of cons with this game though. Firstly the combat is meh. This seems to be a common complaint with the game. It felt more like a last minute addition and was really basic although I personally am not someone who really focuses on combat in these games too much. I'll accept meh combat as long as its not complete garbage. For some people this might be a turnoff though.

I would of liked the collectiables and powerups of this game to be a tiny bit more challenging to collect. It was all pretty easy unlike some other games i've played.

Finally...the escape sequences at the end of the 3 specific dungeons. I don't like them. They were extreme trial and error sequences where you have only seconds to figure out what to do next until you die instantly and have to start the whole thing over again. I know what they were trying to do and it is cool but it was also really annoying.

Other than that, I 100% recommend this to anyone who likes platformers or metroidvanias. You wont regret it.

184665907.review:
Ein magisches Erlebnis, das gleichermaßen begeistert wie fordert

Ori and the Blind Forest ist ein visuell und akustisch beeindruckendes Spiel, das sich nahtlos in das Metroidvania-Genre einfügt. Als Neuling in dieser Art von Spielen war ich gleichermaßen herausgefordert wie fasziniert. Das Spiel bietet eine ausgewogene Mischung aus fordernden Mechaniken, magischer Atmosphäre und einer emotionalen Geschichte – und doch gibt es Aspekte, die für Frustmomente sorgen können.

Stärken
Eine der größten Stärken des Spiels liegt in der immersiven Welt, die durch einen einzigartigen Artstyle und eine berührende musikalische Untermalung zum Leben erweckt wird. Jede Szenerie wirkt wie ein lebendig gewordenes Gemälde, und die Musik verstärkt die magische Stimmung, ohne jemals aufdringlich zu wirken.

Das Erkunden der Welt bereitet Freude, da es immer wieder Belohnungen in Form von Upgrades, neuen Fähigkeiten oder versteckten Details gibt. Der Fortschritt ist hervorragend getaktet – die stetige Einführung neuer Mechaniken sorgt für Abwechslung und fordert den Spieler, seine erlernten Fähigkeiten zu meistern. Besonders gelungen ist, dass das Spiel eine emotionale Bindung zu seinen Figuren aufbaut, obwohl die Geschichte hauptsächlich durch Rückblenden und ohne Dialog erzählt wird.

Schwächen
Trotz seiner vielen positiven Aspekte hat Ori and the Blind Forest auch einige Schwächen, die nicht unerwähnt bleiben dürfen. Der Schwierigkeitsgrad ist durchgehend hoch, was zwar für Genreveteranen spannend sein mag, aber Einsteiger abschrecken könnte. Einige Sequenzen – insbesondere die Fluchtlevel – sind fast abartig schwer und erfordern eine nahezu perfekte Ausführung, was eine gewisse Frustrationsresistenz voraussetzt.

Erschwerend kommt hinzu, dass die Übersichtlichkeit in späteren Leveln leidet. Ob dies ein bewusstes Design der Entwickler ist, um die Herausforderung zu steigern, bleibt offen, doch es trägt nicht unbedingt zum Spielspaß bei.

Fazit
Ori and the Blind Forest ist ein visuell und emotional beeindruckendes Abenteuer, das jedoch durch seinen hohen Schwierigkeitsgrad nicht für jeden Spieler geeignet ist. Die Belohnung für gemeisterte Herausforderungen ist umso größer, doch der Weg dorthin kann mitunter zermürbend sein. Für Fans von Metroidvania-Spielen und solche, die eine Herausforderung suchen, ist es ein absolutes Muss. Wer jedoch ein entspanntes Spielerlebnis erwartet, könnte an seine Grenzen stoßen.

184441451.review:
畫風唯美故事感性的類銀河惡魔城。

比起戰鬥，跑酷跑圖的成分比較重，手殘黨慎入，尤其以逃跑環節的強制捲動為最大之敵。

此外，本作的存檔方式為玩家消耗能量自行設立。
好處是能夠幾乎隨時在自己喜歡的地方存檔，甚至在平台跳躍途中進行存檔。
壞處則是不小心老馬又沒設定存檔點就會導致進度大幅回溯。又或是能量不足以設置存檔點而卡關，需要重複挑戰刷能量才能打破循環。

成就部分有一命通關和速通，以及以特定方式擊殺一定數量敵人。此外，遊戲中可收集要素的技能點是不足以讓玩家一次點滿所有技能的，導致全技能解鎖成就無法避免需要刷怪賺點。

184406171.review:
This is a true Metroidvania game with vibrant beautiful colors. You can't really dislike this game because there's no valid reason to do so. It's enjoyable, packed with various abilities that enhance the fun and excitement. I realy find it baffling how some people dislike the game just because it doesn't align with their personal taste. Honestly, put ur taste in ur **** cus nobody cares. talk instead about the fundamentals that every good game should have.

Although the game didn’t impress me at all  - like other Metroidvania games I’ve played before-  it’s still a good game. Yes, I have some notes about it, especially the skill tree which wasn’t satisfying enough, as well as the combat system, and the lack of bosses in the game. Nevertheless, it’s still enjoyable.

About the story... It felt so casual despite its impactful ending. It’s as if the development team had a great idea for making an enjoyable lovely game but noticed late in the process that the story element was still missing, so they just threw anything in front of them to fill the gap. (honestly this is how i feel every time i play a game with casual story).


Anyway, it’s not the best Metroidvania out there, of course, but it’s a genuine one.. and that’s what truly matters. I’ll definitely love to play the sequel to see what the devs did to improve.


Final score 8/10

184295469.review:
綺麗なグラフィックで描かれるCelesteのようなもの。
ゲーム性は凡庸な2Dプラットフォームアクションに過ぎない。

ひと繋ぎのマップではあるものの、その実態は細切れにされたアスレチックの集合体であり、最初に書いたようにプレイした感覚としてはほぼCelesteである。スキルツリー、バトルなどの要素はほぼおまけであり、ゲームの95%は提示されるアスレチックとそれに対するトライ＆エラーが占める。純粋に操作精度を求められる場面がほとんどだが、即死トラップ・初見殺しも完備しており、見た目に反してなかなかに神経を逆撫でするシーンも。

操作キャラの挙動はややクセがあり、やたらと横方向に伸びるし少し横滑りする。崖掴まりがないのも相まって滑り落ちやすいのはマイナス。
難易度はやや難しい。死にゲーと言って差し支えないほど死ぬが、リトライしやすいため総合的にはクリア困難と言うほどではない。

繰り返しになるが、アートとグラフィックは素晴らしいがそれ以外に特筆すべきものは何もない。決して駄作ではないのでセールで安かったら暇つぶしにやっても悪くはないだろう。
それだけならおすすめしても問題はないクオリティではあるのだが…
私、Celeste嫌いなのよね。

184256177.review:
Ori is heavily platformer focused so if you're not into those types of games this might not be for you, (it is perfect for me though)
Even the bosses in this game are focused on platforming  more than actually fighting the enemy and if you aren't decently good at platforming you might struggle (a lot) with some of the fast paced chasing sections in the game.

On that note..

A breathtaking game stylewise, one of the prettiest games i've played in a long time, and although I think the story was rather predictable I still enjoyed every second of it.
The game plays well and the controls feel smooth most of the time (other than some sections using the glider, I found that using shift and ctrl together in airdash-glide combinations to be kind of cluttery sometimes, especially since you used wasd to move back and forth) thankfully that wasn't an issue I faced very often so it didn't really impact my experience much.

The music in the game is honestly just beautiful and fits the rest of the game's style perfectly.
If you like 2d platformer puzzle games like Celeste and Hollow Knight you'll like this one,
Ori is a lot more forgiving than both of these examples though, both in its platforming (celeste) and in its fighting and health/souls aspect (hollow knight) as you can save the game yourself, baaaasically whenever as long as you have enough blue orbs on you.

Jubbib recommended :thumbsup:

183971368.review:
Beautiful game with fun movement, unfortunately dragged down by some questionable design decisions.

You start out extremely weak, dying in one or two hits. Enemy attack patterns are barely avoidable. You have to save every few steps to avoid having to redo the same section. Making a save costs energy and is on a cooldown. The hp is also saved: respawning doesn't give full health. Combat is boring; it's just an auto-attack, and enemies will have respawned when you backtrack. So it's a war of attrition early on. There are also a lot of places where you don't notice the thorns or an instant-kill trap the first time. There are a few set pieces where you instantly die unless you do what the dev wants. There are gates that take energy to open, so if you saved or used spells you have to farm some enemies before you can proceed. Diving is annoying because you have limited breath. It isn't difficult to have to resurface, just tedious. That sums up the early game, "tedious".

These problems go away once you collect enough abilities, energy and life orbs and unlock enough of the skill tree. Then the game finally becomes fun, but also easy. If you're familiar with Hollow Knight, you'll appreciate that game's design decisions more when playing this.

Ori and the Blind Forest is worth playing if you don't mind the boring fake difficulty in the first few hours. (9h for 100% map completion on Normal)

183562223.review:
ГРАФОНИСТЫЙ HOLLOW KNIGHT ДЛЯ КАЗУАЛОВ (ПОЧТИ)

Поиграв в сей шедевр, я перед аналитикой хочу предупредить вас. От паркура в этой игре у вас будет гореть задница. И вы будете подыхать. Много подыхать. ОЧЕНЬ МНОГО ПОДЫХАТЬ!!!
Вам следует быть готовым к этому, поэтому после первого часа игры и начиная с Древа Гинзо держите у себя на столе под рукой успокоительные таблетки, жмякалку-антистресс и пару вещей, которые вам абсолютно не жалко раздолбать в порыве гнева (И Вазелин не забудьте ещё, обязательно).

Достоинства игры:
1. Визуал.
У игры очень приятная, красочная и насыщенная картинка в мультяшном стиле. Очень много деталей, разнообразие цветов, грамотная работа со светом и тенью уж точно порадует ваш глаз, художникам и дизайнерам игры руки целовал!
2. Сюжет.
Тут всё просто - история о маленьком герое, на плечах которого лежит бремя спасти свой лес от зла, очистить от порчи и вновь разжечь свет! Никаких внезапных сюжетных поворотов или серой морали, самая настоящая сказка для всех возрастов. Постановка роликов и катсцен тоже создаёт впечатление, словно ты смотришь трогательный экспериментальный мультфильм.
3. Саундтрек.
Тут особо распинаться не буду. Музыка из главного меню уже автоматом улетела в мой плейлист ещё с момента запуска игры. Композиторам моё уважение!

МИНУСЫ:
1. Управление (Чуть-чуть).
Здесь оно конечно не для Рахманиновых, которые проходят Hollow Knight одной рукой, играя на бананах, но порой бывают моменты, где тебе нужно чуть ли не Баррэ на клавиатуре зажимать!
Но главная проблема - это то, что иногда Ори бывает непослушным. Например, делает двойной прыжок, когда это не надо (Вроде моментов, когда надо карабкаться), либо и вовсе не желает прыгать. Проблема в том, что ты без особого дрочева можешь сделать что-то, но Ори не хочет.
2. Местами кривые хитбоксы.
Я конкретно про хитбоксы декораций и объектов. Порой Ори могут ранить шипы, даже если он просто подышал возле них, или лазер активируется раньше времени, либо Ори не может сразу ухватиться за ту поверхность, за которую по идее может. И такие моменты будут преследовать всю игру.
3. ЖОСКАЯ нехватка ячеек энергии.
Особенно это касается моментов с сохранениями и созданием себе чекпоинтов. Например, когда ты, не зная чё впереди ждёт, поставив сейв, пролетел, энергии на новое сохранение нет, синие кристаллы поблизости не видно, ты по ошибке подох, а сейв твой стоит за три пi3ды от места смерти. Чувствуете эту боль?

Тем не менее, Ори всё же оставила после себя немало положительных впечатлений, Это достойный платформер с очень ламповой атмосферой и сказочной историей, который я вполне могу порекомендовать любителям подобного жанра или тем, кто хочет себе интересную челленджовую игру.
Сам Я ставлю игре 8.5 ячеек жизни из 10, вполне честная и справедливая оценка.
Хорошая игра!)
